channel.title: BBC News | News Front Page | UK Edition
channel.description: Visit BBC News for up-to-the-minute news, breaking news, video, audio and feature stories. BBC News provides trusted World and UK news as well as local and regional perspectives. Also entertainment, business, science, technology and health news.
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse

item.title: Karadzic 'worked in Serb clinic'
item.description: Captured Bosnian Serb war crimes suspect Radovan Karadzic practised alternative medicine under false ID while living in Belgrade, Serb officials say.

item.title: Israelis hit by new digger attack
item.description: At least 10 people are injured in Jerusalem, as the driver of a construction vehicle rams cars before he is shot dead.

item.title: Batman star quizzed over 'assault'
item.description: Batman star Christian Bale leaves a London police station after being questioned over claims he assaulted his mother and sister.

item.title: Drinks industry facing tough laws
item.description: Ministers tell the drinks industry it must act more responsibly or face new laws governing the sale of alcohol.

item.title: 'Mission change' for UK in Iraq
item.description: Gordon Brown says he expects a "fundamental change of mission" for British troops in Iraq early next year.

item.title: Jury sent out in canoe wife trial
item.description: The jury in the £250,000 fraud trial of canoeist wife Anne Darwin is sent out to consider its verdicts.

item.title: Schools still wait for Sats marks
item.description: There are fears from primary schools that test results that have still not been returned might have been lost.

item.title: Sky launches net music service
item.description: The satellite TV firm teams up with Universal Music to offer downloads for a monthly fee.

item.title: Mercury hat-trick for Monkeys man
item.description: Arctic Monkeys frontman Alex Turner scores his third Mercury Prize nomination in three years with The Last Shadow Puppets.

item.title: You're fed: Brown reveals country home guests
item.description: The list of people Gordon Brown has entertained at Chequers since becoming prime minister has been released.

item.title: Rock drummers 'need the stamina of top athletes'
item.description: Playing the drums for a rock band requires the stamina of a Premiership footballer, research suggests.

item.title: Calzaghe postpones Jones Jr fight
item.description: A hand injury forces Joe Calzaghe to postpone his September super-fight with Roy Jones Jr.

item.title: Crusaders & Salford win licences
item.description: Celtic Crusaders and Salford City Reds will play in Super League next season but Widnes miss out on a licence.

item.title: What do you want to talk about?
item.description: What do you want the world to talk about?

item.title: Mystery maestro
item.description: How did this man's song become the 'UK's most played'?

item.title: Mercury shortlist
item.description: Biographies and video clips of this year's nominees

item.title: 'Chilly, isn't it'
item.description: What's the best way to start talking to a stranger?

item.title: Ford focus
item.description: Luxury and fuel efficiency will boost sales, firm says

item.title: 'Bitter hope'
item.description: Zimbabweans wonder if deal can end violence

item.title: In pictures
item.description: Mourners wear fancy dress for Ben Kinsella funeral

item.title: Two young men dead in reservoir
item.description: Two young men die after disappearing below the water while apparently swimming in a reservoir in Greater Manchester.

item.title: Doctor censured over sleep pills
item.description: A Glasgow doctor behaved irresponsibly by prescribing sleeping tablets to a patient who talked of killing herself, the General Medical Council rules.

item.title: 'Speeding driver' killed boy, 3
item.description: A trial hears how a child who had been playing in the road was run over by a driver who did not stop.

item.title: SAS pay clerk 'stole £100,000'
item.description: About £100,000 in foreign currency taken from the SAS was found outside an Army clerk's NI home, a court martial hears.

item.title: Zimbabweans hail 'historic' deal
item.description: Zimbabweans hail a deal between the president and opposition leader over talks on the country's political crisis.

item.title: Obama urges political fix in Iraq
item.description: US Democratic presidential hopeful Barack Obama says security in Iraq is better but political and diplomatic solutions are needed.

item.title: Iran urged to free HIV pioneers
item.description: A human rights group calls on Iran to release or charge two renowned HIV/Aids doctors arrested last month.

item.title: UN help sought over temple row
item.description: Cambodia asks the UN Security Council for emergency talks to resolve a stand-off with Thailand around an ancient temple.

item.title: BP says 60 staff leaving Russia
item.description: BP says the remaining 60 of its staff seconded to joint venture TNK-BP are being recalled from Russia.

item.title: Indian government survives vote
item.description: India's government wins a tight parliamentary vote of confidence over a civilian nuclear deal with the US.

item.title: Fuel sellers start cutting prices
item.description: UK drivers are set to benefit after a number retailers including Asda, Morrisons and BP said that they would cut petrol prices.

item.title: Brown 'in charge' over the summer
item.description: Gordon Brown will be in charge of the government this summer - even while he is away on holiday, his spokesman says.

item.title: Drug for deadly prostate cancer
item.description: Scientists say a drug to treat aggressive prostate cancer may be the most significant advance in the field for 70 years.

item.title: 'A fifth of teens' carry a weapon
item.description: Almost one in five teenage pupils carries a weapon, although only one in 20 takes it to school, a study suggests.

item.title: Clean deadline call on coal power
item.description: The government should set a deadline for coal power stations to "clean up" or close, a parliamentary committee says.

item.title: Rowling's Harry Potter 'regret'
item.description: Harry Potter author JK Rowling speaks of her regret that she never told her mother about her world-famous creation.

item.title: Tiscali accuses BT of defamation
item.description: Tiscali has issued legal proceedings against BT after it sent letters to its customers.
